clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used in the treatment of dry cough

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Chlophedianol or Clofedanol is a centrally acting cough suppressant It has local anesthetic and antihistamine properties and may have anticholinergic effects at high doses

incompatibilities.description: Clofedanol may decrease effectiveness of Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine as a diagnostic agent
The therapeutic efficacy of Betahistine can be decreased when used in combination with Clofedanol
Amphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Phentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Benzphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Diethylpropion may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Lisdexamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Mephentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
MMDA may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Midomafetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
4 Bromo 2 5 dimethoxyamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Tenamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Chlorphentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Methylenedioxyethamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Dextroamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Metamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Iofetamine I 123 may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Ritobegron may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Mephedrone may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Methoxyphenamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
Gepefrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylthioamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Clofedanol
The therapeutic efficacy of Pitolisant can be decreased when used in combination with Clofedanol
